member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current TableObject with another TableObject of the same type.
member.param: A TableObject to compare with this TableObject.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the relative order of the table objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the other parameter. Zero This object is equal to other. Greater than zero This object is greater than other.
member.remarks: If both table objects are no of the same type it will return zero. The comparision is made by their names.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.CompareTo(netDxf.Tables.TableObject)
member.summary: Compares the current TableObject with another TableObject of the same type.
member.param: A TableObject to compare with this TableObject.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the relative order of the table objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the other parameter. Zero This object is equal to other. Greater than zero This object is greater than other.
member.remarks: If both table objects are no of the same type it will return zero. The comparision is made by their names.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.Equals(netDxf.Tables.TableObject)
member.summary: Check if two TableObject are equal.
member.returns: True if two TableObject are equal or false in anyother case.
member.remarks: Two TableObjects are considered equals if their names are the same, regardless of their internal values. This is done this way because in a dxf two TableObjects cannot have the same name.

member.name: T:netDxf.Collections.Layouts
member.summary: Represents a collection of layouts.
member.remarks: AutoCad limits the number of layouts to 256, but at the same time it allows to import dxf files with more than that, for this reason the max capacity has been set to short.MaxValue. The maximum number of layouts is also limited by the number of blocks, due to that for each layout a block record must exist in the blocks collection.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a layout and removes the layout entities from the document.
member.param: Layout name to remove from the document.
member.returns: True is the layout has been successfully removed, or false otherwise.
member.remarks:
The ModelSpace layout cannot be remove. If all PaperSpace layouts have been removed a default PaperSpace will be created since it is required by the dxf implementation.
When a Layout is deleted all entities that has been added to it will also be removed.
Removing a Layout will rebuild the PaperSpace block names, to follow the naming rule: Paper_Space, Paper_Space0, Paper_Space1, ...

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.DimensionArrowhead
member.summary: Predefined shapes for dimension style arrowheads.
member.remarks:
Arrowhead block names and its representation.
"" = closed filled
"_DOT" = dot
"_DOTSMALL" = dot small
"_DOTBLANK" = dot blank
"_ORIGIN" = origin indicator
"_ORIGIN2" = origin indicator 2
"_OPEN" = open
"_OPEN90" = right angle
"_OPEN30" = open 30
"_CLOSED" = closed
"_SMALL" = dot small blank
"_NONE" = none
"_OBLIQUE" = oblique
"_BOXFILLED" = box filled
"_BOXBLANK" = box
"_CLOSEDBLANK" = closed blank
"_DATUMFILLED" = datum triangle filled
"_DATUMBLANK" = datum triangle
"_INTEGRAL" = integral
"_ARCHTICK" = architectural tick

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Mesh
member.summary: Represents a mesh entity.
member.remarks:
Use this entity to overcome the limitations of the PolyfaceMesh, but, keep in mind that this entity was first introduced in AutoCad 2010.
The maximum number of faces a mesh can have is 16000000 (16 millions).

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Viewport.Stacking
member.summary:
Viewport status field:
-1 = On, but is fully off screen, or is one of the viewports that is not active because the $MAXACTVP count is currently being exceeded.
0 = Off
1 = Stacking value reserved for the layout view. positive value = On and active. The value indicates the order of stacking for the viewports, where 1 is the active viewport, 2 is the next, and so forth.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Viewport.ClippingBoundary
member.summary: Entity that serves as the viewport's clipping boundary (only present if viewport is non-rectangular).
member.remarks:
Only closed lightweight polylines, closed polylines, circles, full ellipses and closed splines are allowed.
Only X and Y coordinates will be used the entity normal will be considered as UnitZ.
When the viewport is added to the document this entity will be added too.

member.name: T:netDxf.Objects.ImageDef
member.summary: Represents an image definition.

member.name: M:netDxf.Objects.ImageDef.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,netDxf.ImageResolutionUnits)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ImageDef class.
member.param: Image file name with full or relative path.

remarks.para: The name of the file without extension will be used as the name of the image definition.
This is a generic constructor for all image formats supported by AutoCAD, note that not all AutoCAD versions support the same image formats.

Note (this is from the ACAD docs): AutoCAD 2000, AutoCAD LT 2000, and later releases do not support LZW-compressed TIFF files, with the exception of English language versions sold in the US and Canada.
If you have TIFF files that were created using LZW compression and want to insert them into a drawing you must resave the TIFF files with LZW compression disabled.

member.name: M:netDxf.Objects.ImageDef.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,netDxf.ImageResolutionUnits)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ImageDef class.
member.param: Image file name with full or relative path.
Image definition name, if null or empty the file name without the extension will be used.

remarks.para: The name assigned to the image definition must be unique.
This is a generic constructor for all image formats supported by AutoCAD, note that not all AutoCAD versions support the same image formats.

Note (this is from the ACAD docs): AutoCAD 2000, AutoCAD LT 2000, and later releases do not support LZW-compressed TIFF files, with the exception of English language versions sold in the US and Canada.
If you have TIFF files that were created using LZW compression and want to insert them into a drawing you must resave the TIFF files with LZW compression disabled.

member.name: M:netDxf.Objects.ImageDef.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ImageDef class.
member.param: Image file name with full or relative path.

remarks.para: The name of the file without extension will be used as the name of the image definition.

Supported image formats: BMP, JPG, PNG, TIFF.
Eventhought AutoCAD supports more image formats, this constructor is restricted to the ones the net framework supports in common with AutoCAD. Use the generic constructor instead.

Note (this is from the ACAD docs): AutoCAD 2000, AutoCAD LT 2000, and later releases do not support LZW-compressed TIFF files, with the exception of English language versions sold in the US and Canada.
If you have TIFF files that were created using LZW compression and want to insert them into a drawing you must resave the TIFF files with LZW compression disabled.

Eventhought AutoCAD supports more image formats, this constructor is restricted to the ones the .net library supports in common with AutoCAD. Use the generic constructor instead.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MLine.CalculateVertexesInfo
member.summary: Calculates the internal information of the multiline vertexes.

remarks.para: This function will be called when the entity created or when setting its vertexes; but, afterwards, this function will need to be called manually if any modification are done to the multiline.

If the vertex distance list needs to be edited to represent trimmed multilines this function needs to be called prior any modification. It will calculate the minimun information needed to build a correct multiline.

member.summary: Gets the MLine vertex direction.

member.summary: Gets the MLine vertex miter.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MLineVertex.Distances
member.summary: Gets the multiline vertex distances lists.

remarks.para: There is a list for every MLineStyle element, and every list contains an array of real values that parameterize the start and end point of every element of the style.

The first value (index 0) represents the distance from the segment vertex along the miter vector to the point where the line element's path intersects the miter vector.
The second value (index 1) is the distance along the line element's direction from the point, defined by the first value, to the actual start of the line element.
The successive values list the start and stop points of the line element breaks or cuts in this segment of the mline.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.MText
member.summary: Represents a multiline text entity.
member.remarks:
Formatting codes for MText, you can use them directly while setting the text value or use the Write() method.
\L Start underline
\l Stop underline
\O Start overstrike
\o Stop overstrike
\K Start strike-through
\k Stop strike-through
\P New paragraph (new line)
\pxi Control codes for bullets, numbered paragraphs and columns
\X Paragraph wrap on the dimension line (only in dimensions)
\Q Slanting (obliquing) text by angle - e.g. \Q30;
\H Text height - e.g. \H3x;
\W Text width - e.g. \W0.8x;
\F Font selection
e.g. \Fgdt;o - GDT-tolerance
e.g. \Fkroeger|b0|i0|c238|p10; - font Kroeger, non-bold, non-italic, codepage 238, pitch 10
\S Stacking, fractions
e.g. \SA^B;
A
B
e.g. \SX/Y
X
-
Y
e.g. \S1#4;
1/4
\A Alignment
\A0; = bottom
\A1; = center
\A2; = top
\C Color change
\C1; = red
\C2; = yellow
\C3; = green
\C4; = cyan
\C5; = blue
\C6; = magenta
\C7; = white
\T Tracking, char.spacing - e.g. \T2;
\~ Non-wrapping space, hard space
{} Braces - define the text area influenced by the code
\ Escape character - e.g. \\ = "\", \{ = "{"
Codes and braces can be nested up to 8 levels deep.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MText.RectangleWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the text reference rectangle width.
member.remarks:
This value defines the width of the box where the text will fit.
If a paragraph width is longer than the rectangle width it will be broken in several lines, using the word spaces as breaking points.
If you specify a width of 0, word wrap is turned off and the width of the multiline text object is as wide as the longest line of text.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.#ctor(netDxf.Entities.HatchPattern,System.Collections.Generic.List{netDxf.Entities.HatchBoundaryPath})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Hatch class.
member.remarks: The hatch boundary paths must be on the same plane as the hatch. The normal and the elevation of the boundary paths will be omited (the hatch elevation and normal will be used instead). Only the x and y coordinates for the center of the line, ellipse, circle and arc will be used.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.CreateWCSBoundary
member.summary: Creates a list of entities that represents the boundary of the hatch in world coordinates.
member.returns: A list of entities that makes the boundary of the hatch in world coordinates.
member.remarks: The generated list can be used to directly draw the hatch boundary given the normal and elevation of the hatch. All entities are in world coordinates except the LwPolyline boundary path since by definition its vertexes are expressed in object coordinates. This list differs in that the hatch entities list are in local coordinates of the hatch while with this method the entities are transformed by the normal and elevetation of it.

member.summary: Gets the hatch pattern.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.BoundaryPaths
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch boundary paths.
member.remarks: The hatch must contain at least on valid boundary path to be able to add it to the DxfDocument, otherwise it will be rejected.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.Elevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch elevation, its position along its normal.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.HatchBoundaryPath
member.summary: Represent a loop of a hatch boundaries.
member.remarks:
The entities that make a loop can be any combination of lines, polylines, circles, arcs, ellipses, and splines.
The entities that define a loop must define a closed path and they have to be on the same plane as the hatch, if these conditions are not met the result will be unpredictable.
The entitiy normal and the elevation will be ignored. Only the x and y coordinates of the line, ellipse, the circle, and spline will be used. Circles, full ellipses, closed polylines, closed splines are closed paths so only one should exist in the edges list. Lines, arcs, ellipse arcs, open polylines, and open splines are open paths so more enties should exist to make a closed loop.

member.summary: Current text style.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.LUnits
member.summary: Units format for coordinates and distances.
member.remarks:
Default value: Decimal.
If the LUnits is set to Architectural or Engineering the InsUnits variable will be set to Inches automatically.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.LUprec
member.summary: Units precision for coordinates and distances.
member.remarks: Valid values are integers from 0 to 8. Default value: 4.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.DwgCodePage
member.summary: Drawing code page; set to the system code page when a new drawing is created, but not otherwise maintained by AutoCAD.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.Extnames
member.summary: Controls symbol table naming.
member.remarks:
Default value: 1.
Controls symbol table naming:
0 = Release 14 compatibility. Limits names to 31 characters in length.
Names can include the letters A to Z, the numerals 0 to 9, and the special characters dollar sign ($), underscore (_), and hyphen (-).
1 = AutoCAD 2000.
Names can be up to 255 characters in length, and can include the letters A to Z, the numerals 0 to 9, spaces, and any special characters not used for other purposes by Microsoft Windows and AutoCAD.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.InsBase
member.summary: insertion base point for the current drawing.
member.remarks: When you insert or externally reference the current drawing into other drawings, this base point is used as the insertion base point.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.InsUnits
member.summary: Specifies a drawing units value for automatic scaling of blocks, images, or xrefs when inserted or attached to a drawing.
member.remarks:
Default value: Unitless.
It is not recommend to change this value, if the LUnits variable has been set to Architectural or Engineering, they require the InsUnits to be set at Inches.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.LastSavedBy
member.summary: User name that saved the file.
member.remarks:
By default it uses the user name of the person who is currently logged on to the Windows operating system.
This header variable is not compatible with AutoCad2000 or lower versions.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.LtScale
member.summary: Global linetype scale.
member.remarks: Default value: 1.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.LwDisplay
member.summary: Controls the display of lineweights on the Model or Layout tab.
member.remarks:
Default value: false.
false = Lineweight is not displayed.
true = Lineweight is displayed.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.PdMode
member.summary: Controls the shape to draw a point entity.
member.remarks: Default value: PointShape.Dot.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.PdSize
member.summary: Controls the size of the point figures, except for PDMODE values 0 (Dot) and 1 (Empty).
member.remarks:
Default value: 0.
A setting of 0 generates the point at 5 percent of the drawing area height.
A positive PDSIZE value specifies an absolute size for the point figures.
A negative value is interpreted as a percentage of the viewport size.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.PLineGen
member.summary: Governs the generation of linetype patterns around the vertices of a 2D polyline.
member.remarks:
Default value: 0.
1 = Linetype is generated in a continuous pattern around vertices of the polyline.
0 = Each segment of the polyline starts and ends with a dash.

member.name: P:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariables.TdCreate
member.summary: Local date/time of drawing creation.
member.remarks: This date/time is local to the time zone where the file was created.

member.summary: Universal date/time the drawing was created.

A positive PDSIZE value specifies an absolute size for the point figures.
A negative value is interpreted as a percentage of the viewport size.

member.name: F:netDxf.Header.HeaderVariableCode.PLineGen
member.summary: Governs the generation of linetype patterns around the vertices of a 2D polyline.
member.remarks:
1 = Linetype is generated in a continuous pattern around vertices of the polyline.
0 = Each segment of the polyline starts and ends with a dash.

member.summary: Sets the distance the dimension line extends beyond the extension line when oblique, architectural tick, integral, or no marks are drawn for arrowheads.
member.remarks: Default: 0.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMDLI
member.summary: Controls the spacing of the dimension lines in baseline dimensions.
member.remarks:
Default: 0.38
This value is stored only for information purposes. Base dimensions are a compound entity made of several dimensions, there is no actual dxf entity that represents that.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMCLRE
member.summary: Assigns colors to extension lines, center marks, and centerlines.
member.remarks:
Default: ByBlock
Only indexed indexed aci colors are supported.

member.summary: Sets the linetype of the first extension line.
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMLTEX2
member.summary: Sets the linetype of the second extension line.
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMLWE
member.summary: Assigns lineweight to extension lines.
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMSE1
member.summary: Suppresses display of the first extension line.
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMSE2
member.summary: Suppresses display of the second extension line.
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMEXO
member.summary: Specifies how far extension lines are offset from origin points.
member.remarks: Default: 0.0625

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMEXE
member.summary: Specifies how far to extend the extension line beyond the dimension line.
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMASZ
member.summary: Controls the size of dimension line and leader line arrowheads. Also controls the size of hook lines.
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMCEN
member.summary: Controls drawing of circle or arc center marks and centerlines.
member.remarks:
0 - No center marks or lines are drawn.
greter than 0 - Center marks are drawn.
lower than 0 - Center marks and centerlines are drawn.
The absolute value specifies the size of the center mark or centerline. The size of the centerline is the length of the centerline segment that extends outside the circle or arc. It is also the size of the gap between the center mark and the start of the centerline. The size of the center mark is the distance from the center of the circle or arc to the end of the center mark.
Default: 0.09

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMSAH
member.summary: Controls the display of dimension line arrowhead blocks.
member.remarks:
Default value: false.
false = Use arrowhead blocks set by DIMBLK.
true = Use arrowhead blocks set by DIMBLK1 and DIMBLK2.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMBLK
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block displayed at the ends of dimension lines.
member.remarks: Default: null. Closed filled.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMBLK1
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block for the first end of the dimension line when the drawing variable DIMSAH is true.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMBLK2
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block for the second end of the dimension line when the drawing variable DIMSAH is true.
member.remarks: Default: null. Closed filled.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMTXSTY
member.summary: Gets or sets the text style of the dimension.
member.remarks: Default: Standard

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMCLRT
member.summary: Assigns colors to dimension text.
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMTXT
member.summary: Specifies the height of dimension text, unless the current text style has a fixed height.
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMGAP
member.summary: Sets the distance around the dimension text when the dimension line breaks to accommodate dimension text.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMJUST
member.summary: Controls the horizontal positioning of dimension text.
member.remarks: Default: Centered

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMTAD
member.summary: Controls the vertical position of text in relation to the dimension line.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMSCALE
member.summary: Get or set the overall scale factor applied to dimensioning variables that specify sizes, distances, or offsets.
member.remarks:
DIMSCALE does not affect measured lengths, coordinates, or angles.
DIMSCALE values of zero are not supported, any imported drawing with a zero value will set the scale to the default 1.0.
Default: 1.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMTIH
member.summary: Controls the position of dimension text inside the extension lines for all dimension types except Ordinate.
member.remarks: Default: 0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMTOH

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMDEC
member.summary: Sets the number of decimal places displayed for the primary units of a dimension.
member.remarks: Default: 2

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMADEC
member.summary: Controls the number of precision places displayed in angular dimensions.
member.remarks: Default: 0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMPOST
member.summary: Specifies a text prefix or suffix (or both) to the dimension measurement.
member.remarks:
Use "<>" to indicate placement of the text in relation to the dimension value. For example, enter "<>mm" to display a 5.0 millimeter radial dimension as "5.0mm". If you entered "mm <>", the dimension would be displayed as "mm 5.0". Use the "<>" mechanism for angular dimensions.
Default: "<>"

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMDSEP
member.summary: Specifies a single-character decimal separator to use when creating dimensions whose unit format is decimal.
member.remarks: Default: "."

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DIMAUNIT
member.summary: Gets the units format for angular dimensions.
member.remarks: 0 Decimal degrees 1 Degrees/minutes/seconds 2 Gradians 3 Radians

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.AddEntity(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{netDxf.Entities.EntityObject})
member.summary: Adds a list of entities to the document.
member.param: A list of entities to add to the document.

remarks.para: Once an entity has been added to the dxf document, it should not be modified. A unique handle identifier is assigned to every entity.

This is specially true in the case of dimensions. The block that represents the drawing of the dimension is built when it is added to the document. If a property is modified once it has been added this modifications will not be reflected in the saved dxf file.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.AddEntity(netDxf.Entities.EntityObject)
member.summary: Adds an entity to the document.
member.param: An entity to add to the document.
member.returns: True if the entity has been added to the document, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Once an entity has been added to the dxf document a unique handle identifier (hexadecimal number) is assigned to them.

The entities should not be modified. This is specially true in the case of dimensions. The block that represents the drawing of the dimension is built when it is added to the document. If a property is modified once it has been added this modifications will not be reflected in the saved dxf file.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.RemoveEntity(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{netDxf.Entities.EntityObject})
member.summary: Removes a list of entities from the document.
member.param: A list of entities to remove from the document.
member.remarks:
This function will not remove other tables objects that might be not in use as result from the elimination of the entity.
This includes empity layers, blocks not referenced anymore, line types, text styles, dimension styles, and application registries.
Entities that are part of a block definition will not be removed.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.RemoveEntity(netDxf.Entities.EntityObject)
member.summary: Removes an entity from the document.
member.param: The entity to remove from the document.
member.returns: True if item is successfully removed; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if item was not found.
member.remarks:
This function will not remove other tables objects that might be not in use as result from the elimination of the entity.
This includes empity layers, blocks not referenced anymore, line types, text styles, dimension styles, multiline styles, groups, and application registries.
Entities that are part of a block definition will not be removed.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a dxf file.
member.returns: Returns a DxfDocument. It will return null if the file has not been able to load.
member.remarks:
Loading dxf files prior to AutoCad 2000 is not supported.
The Load method will still raise an exception if they are unable to create the FileStream.
On Debug mode it will raise any exception that migh occur during the whole process.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.Load(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads a dxf file.
member.returns: Returns a DxfDocument. It will return null if the file has not been able to load.
member.remarks:
Loading dxf files prior to AutoCad 2000 is not supported.
On Debug mode it will raise any exception that might occur during the whole process.
The caller will be responsible of closing the stream.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Attribute
member.summary: Represents a attribute entity.
member.remarks:
The attribute position, rotation, height and width factor values also includes the transformation of the Insert entity to which it belongs.
During the attribute initialization a copy of all attribute definition properties will be copied, so any changes made to the attribute definition will only be applied to new attribute instances and not to existing ones. This behaviour is to allow imported Insert entities to have attributes without definition in the block, althought this might sound not totally correct it is allowed by AutoCad.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.PolyfaceMeshFace
member.summary: Represents a polyface mesh face.
member.remarks:
The way the vertex indexes for a polyfacemesh are defined follows the dxf documentation. The values of the vertex indexes specify one of the previously defined vertexes by the index in the list plus one. If the index is negative, the edge that begins with that vertex is invisible. For example if the vertex index in the list is 0 the vertex index for the face will be 1, and if the edge between the vertexes 0 and 1 is hidden the vertex index for the face will be -1.
The maximum number of vertexes per face is 4.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.TransformAttributes
member.summary: Recalculate the attributes position, rotation, height and width factor with the values applied to the insertion.
member.remarks:
The attributes position, rotation, height and width factor values includes the transformations applied to the insertion, if required this method will calculate the proper values according to the ones defined by the attribute definition.
Initially the attribute properties holds the same values as the attribute definition but once it belongs to an insertion its values can be changed manually independently to its definition, usually you will want that the position, rotation, height and/or width factor to be transformed with the insert as is the behaviour inside AutoCad.
This method only applies to attributes that have a definition, some dxf files might generate attributes that have no definition in the block.

member.name: T:netDxf.XDataCode
member.summary: Defines the extended data code.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.String
member.summary: Strings in extended data can be up to 255 bytes long.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.AppReg
member.summary: Application names can be up to 31 bytes long.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.ControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either {or }. These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.LayerName
member.summary: Name of the layer associated with the extended data

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.BinaryData
member.summary: Binary data is organized into variable-length chunks. The maximum length of each chunk is 127 bytes. The binary data is represented as a string of hexadecimal digits, two per binary byte.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.DatabaseHandle
member.summary: Handles of entities in the drawing database.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealX
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealY
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealZ
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionX
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionY
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionZ
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.OpenControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either {or }. These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested.

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.CloseControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either "{" or "}". These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested.
